Welcome to Clockwork Roasted Coffee!


About

Welcome to the official website of our robotics team for the TakTik 2025 competition! We are a team passionate about robotics, programming, and web design, brought together around a captivating theme: Steampunk. As you may have seen in our video or our video game, we gave our all during the months of work to exceed your expectations and inspire you to join the world we have created around our theme.

Qu'est-ce que la CRC?


The CRC Robotics Competition is an annual event where teams of college-level students design, build, and program a robot to complete specific tasks in a themed game. This competition tests their skills in engineering, programming, and teamwork. Every year, a new challenge is presented, inspired by real-world or futuristic situations. Teams must analyze the game rules, design a high-performing robot, and develop strategies to maximize their points during matches. But the CRC is not limited to robotics! In addition to the robot, participants must create a themed booth, produce a presentation video, and develop a website to document their project. The entrepreneurial aspect is also emphasized with sponsorship searches and project management. Beyond the competition, the CRC promotes the development of both technical and interpersonal skills. It represents a unique opportunity to collaborate, innovate, and face challenges in a spirit of camaraderie and perseverance. In short, the CRC is an immersive experience that prepares students for the world of engineering and science while allowing them to live an exciting human and technological adventure!





The Game Field: The field is a large area with nine stations where robots can place rings. These stations are arranged to form a three-by-three grid, similar to a tic-tac-toe board.


Game Objective: Teams must use their robots to place rings in the field's stations. When a team controls three aligned stations in a row, column, or diagonal, they earn a point multiplier for these stations, thus increasing their score.


Essential Rules: For the starting zones, the robots start in one of the two assigned starting zones. To control a station, the robots must place rings according to certain conditions, teams must be the first to place a ring in one of the zones, and for the others, the teams must be the last and/or have the greatest dominance in that section. Each match lasts 5 minutes, during which teams must execute their strategies to score as many points as possible.


Skills Developed: TAKTIK 2025 allows participants to develop various skills, including: Engineering and Design: Designing and building a functional robot adapted to the game's challenges. Programming: Programming the robot to perform tasks autonomously or respond to operators' commands. Strategy: Developing plans to control the stations and optimize the score. Teamwork: Collaborating effectively with teammates to achieve common goals.


Robot conceptualization based on the competition goals.


Robot construction.


Creation of the booth.


Creation of the video.


The problems we encountered over the months are:


For the robot conceptualization, we decided to integrate a swerve drive to make the robot ultra-maneuverable, but the programming turned out to be much more complicated than expected. Each test forced us to adjust our calculations and refine the motor synchronization. Despite the challenges, we knew that if we succeeded, our robot would have a serious advantage.

For the construction of the robot, the launcher was designed quickly and worked well from the first tests. However, integrating all the systems together was a real puzzle, especially with the electronics and communication between the motors. After hours of adjustments and tests, our robot is finally ready to perform on the field!

For the booth, the first obstacle we encountered was that we didn’t know exactly what it should look like. We eventually opted for a main counter as well as walls on which we would hang many steampunk accessories. We then had to transport the panels for building the walls in a U-Haul. For the rest, we only encountered one more issue when storing the panels and the counter. We had stored the walls in a room near our space during spring break, but we had to move them in front of our space before classes resumed.

And finally, for the video, the biggest obstacle we encountered was that we were missing actors and equipment to film. Fortunately, our library lent us high-quality equipment, and the members of our committee eagerly took part in the video staging. Also, with the little time we had after spring break, Ana had to write the script in two weeks, film it in one week, and edit the video in 11 days. As you’ve seen, the video is amazing, and we are very proud of it.

Logbook

Day 1: Kevin, still shaken by the loss of his grandfather, goes to his house to collect some personal items. In a dark corner of the kitchen, he finds the old coffee machine his grandfather used, a bit rusty but full of memories. He decides to take it with him, even though the idea of using it feels nostalgic. He has no idea yet that this machine will be the starting point of something big.

Kevin is now ready to take the big step. He receives his brand-new coffee machine, far more advanced than his grandfather's. As soon as he turns it on, he knows he’s on the right track. The aromas that fill the air are a delight. Kevin makes several cups for his friends and family, all of whom are impressed. This day marks a turning point in his journey, and Kevin starts thinking about how he could share this passion with others.

Day 2: Kevin tries to make his first coffee with his grandfather’s machine. The taste is far from exceptional, but there’s something magical about the experience. Even though he’s frustrated by the process’s slowness and the mediocre taste, he starts thinking that perhaps he could turn this into his passion. The idea of a coffee empire begins to slowly form in his mind.

Day 3: Kevin researches different coffee machines and reads online forums to learn more about the best models. He starts imagining a coffee-related business, thinking that perhaps this old machine is just the beginning. He’s determined to improve his coffee-making skills.

Day 4: Kevin finally buys his new coffee machine. After saving up and choosing a high-end model, he installs it at home with excitement. The first coffee he makes is exceptional. He’s so pleased with the result that he begins to think big. The taste is rich, the texture perfect. This is the moment Kevin decides that his dream of a coffee empire can become a reality.

Day 5: With his new machine, Kevin starts selling coffee to his friends and neighbors. The feedback is positive, and he realizes there’s a market for his product. The idea of opening a small café or stand starts to take shape. But he quickly realizes that he needs to refine his approach to make his coffee even more appealing.

Day 6: Kevin’s orders increase as more people discover the quality of his coffee. He starts taking notes on sales management, how to optimize service, and how to handle the growing demand. He meets a local investor who shows interest in supporting his coffee venture. The idea of having a real point of sale begins to seem more and more feasible.

Day 7: Encouraged by the growing interest, Kevin decides to find a location for his first coffee stand. After visiting several spots, he finds a small corner in a local market, perfect for attracting regular customers. He begins planning the stand’s layout and preparing for the grand opening. The excitement is palpable. He sees not just a coffee stand, but the first step toward his empire.

Day 8: Kevin’s coffee stand quickly becomes popular, and he starts attracting regular customers. He hires a few friends to help because demand is greater than he expected. Hours fly by, and sales continue to rise. Kevin begins to realize that he could expand into a small chain of stands. He also receives offers to partner for events and local festivals.

Day 9: Kevin’s business continues to grow. He builds relationships with coffee suppliers, local producers, and other entrepreneurs. These encounters allow him to expand his network and refine his vision. However, logistical challenges intensify, especially when it comes to stock management and maintaining service quality. Kevin realizes he needs to find solutions to handle the growth.

The much-anticipated moment arrives: Kevin buys his first coffee stand. He secures the space at the market and begins setting up his little counter. It’s hard work, but Kevin is determined. On opening day, he’s both nervous and excited. His first customers are regulars from the market, and they’re thrilled to discover such refined coffee. Kevin is delighted to see his dream start to take shape.

Finally, thanks to the success of his stand, Kevin manages to buy his first coffee shop. He takes over a location in a bustling neighborhood and carefully designs the space. This place is more than just a café; it’s a hub for coffee lovers, where people can relax, work, or meet over a great cup of coffee. Kevin is proud to see his project becoming a reality. The coffee empire he had envisioned is beginning to take shape in this shop.

Day 10: Kevin enjoys the grand opening of his coffee shop. It’s a big moment for him, and he’s overwhelmed with emotion. Customers flock to the shop, drawn by the reputation he’s starting to build. He knows this is just the beginning, but today, he looks at his journey with pride. Kevin’s story, which began with an old coffee machine inherited from his grandfather, is taking an exciting and promising turn.
